```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(olsrr)
```

An example of why $R^2$ is not an ideal criterion.
```{r}
pf<-data.frame(x=c(1,3),y=c(1,5))
summary(lm(y~x,data=pf))
plot(pf)
```


Import data from Exercise 9.10: Job Proficiency
```{r}
jp <- read_table2("/Volumes/5ive3rds/CSULB/Classes/510/Data/Data Sets KN/KutnerData/Chapter  9 Data Sets/CH09PR10.txt", col_names = c("y","x1","x2","x3","x4"))

fit.jp<-lm(y~.,data=jp)  #full model
summary(fit.jp)
```


All possible Regressions
```{r}
olsrr::ols_step_all_possible(fit.jp)
plot(ols_step_all_possible(fit.jp))
```

Best Subset Regression, Corner Principle
```{r}
ols_step_best_subset(fit.jp)
plot(ols_step_best_subset(fit.jp))
```

To isolate one criterion for a better view:
```{r}
ols_step_best_subset(fit.jp)$cp #Cp values. See documentation for others
plot(ols_step_best_subset(fit.jp)$cp,type="l") #plot
```
